Job Description

Data Scientist

When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, youll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and youll be supported in achieving your career goals.

The Security Data Scientist has global responsibility to design, implement, and document data normalization, use cases, alerting, and data enrichment of our security and corporate data.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Mine, analyze, and normalize data from multiple information sources to drive security requirements for product security, risk management, and incident response
  • Develop statistical data models and algorithms that predict unusual behavior and identify cyber threats
  • Closely coordinate with the threat intelligence team to correlate indicators with security data sets
  • Aggregate data from a variety of datasets, automate data collection and processing
  • Identify and drive implementation of new data sources
  • Coordinate with multiple functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
  • Work with multiple business lines throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging corporate data to drive business security solutions
  • Update documentation to reflect the current operating environment
  • Design dashboards and metrics to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • Work with other technology experts, ensuring proper integration between systems
  • Interact with Senior Management and provide updates, as necessary.
Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science
  • 5-7 years of related experience
  • Equivalent combination of experience and education will be considered
  • Strong understanding of statistics, experimental design and data mining methods
  • 3 years of experience supporting a log management system including data normalization, operation, maintenance, custom content creation
  • Experience in data normalization from multiple sources including databases, email, IDS, servers, authentication, and security applications
  • Must be well versed in Splunk technology and be a seasoned Splunk administrator with knowledge of distributed search, index clustering and search head clustering
  • Experience integrating several security technologies into Splunk including IDS/IPS, Security Information Event Management (SIEM), log management, vulnerability assessment/scanning, network analysis/packet sniffer, patch management, antivirus/antimalware
  • Proficient in technical writing and the ability to present complex, technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Remote applicants will be considered
